titleInfo.title: LSU cadets of Prize Company in formation on old campus.

subject.topic: Louisiana State University and Agricultural and Mechanical College

mods.note: 'The second Baton Rouge campus of Louisiana State University occupied the grounds of the U. S. Army garrison in 1886, having moved from the first Baton Rouge campus on the grounds of the Louisiana State Institute for the Deaf, Dumb, and Blind. The Lytle Studio created a number of photographs for the first LSU yearbook, The Gumbo, in 1900. The university was a military institution well into the twentieth century, with classes organized into companies along army models. This image of the Prize Company, 1887, indicates one such company that may have had the fewest demerits and best performance.' Mark E. Martin, in Andrew D. Lytleâ€™s Baton Rouge: photographs 1863-1910, (Baton Rouge, LSU Press, 2008), p. 69.

titleInfo.title: Andrew D. Lytle's Baton Rouge' Photograph Collection/

mods.accessCondition: Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright of the original material is retained in accordance with U.S. copyright laws. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Division, Louisiana State University Libraries.
Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
mods.note: LSU Photograph Collection, RG# A5000, Louisiana State University Archives, LSU Libraries, Baton Rouge, La.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
